intro: Onosma rupestris, commonly known as the rock onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, pink to purple flowers in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Botanically, it belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy inflorescences.
